videoSnippet.title: Converting -10 Into a Win || Praggnanandhaa vs Firouzja || FTX Crypto Cup (2022)
videoSnippet.description:
Watch entire Bobby Fischer saga here! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0A8-8M8fb04&list=PLDnx7w_xuguENa5LgFG7Gi8aYRVVnXxFE

Have a great day :)

Praggnanandhaa (2751) - Firouzja, Alireza (2793) 1-0
FTX Crypto Cup (chess24.com) [1] 2022.08.15
C41 Philidor, Improved Hanham variation

1.e4 d6 2.d4 Nf6 3.Nc3 e5 4.Nf3 Nbd7 5.Bc4 Be7 6.O-O O-O 7.Re1 c6 8.a4 h6 9.h3 Re8 10.a5 Bf8 11.Be3 exd4 12.Bxd4 Qc7 13.Ba2 Ne5 14.Nh4 Be6 15.Bxe6 Rxe6 16.Nf5 g6 17.Nh4 Nh5 18.g3 Qd8 19.Ng2 Nd7 20.Kh2 Nhf6 21.f4 Bg7 22.Qd3 Qc7 23.Rf1 a6 24.f5 Ne5 25.Bxe5 Rxe5 26.fxg6 fxg6 27.Nh4 Kh7 28.Nf3 Rh5 29.Ne2 Ng4+ 30.Kg2 Ne5 31.Nxe5 Rxe5 32.Rf4 Rae8 33.Raf1 R8e7 34.b4 d5 35.Nc3 Qd6 36.R1f3 Qe6 37.exd5 cxd5 38.Nd1 Re2+ 39.Nf2 d4 40.Qb3 Qc6 41.h4 h5 42.Qd3 R7e3 43.Qd1 Qxc2 44.Qxc2 Rxc2 45.Rf7 Kh6 46.Rxb7 Ree2 47.Rd7 d3 48.Rdxd3 Rb2 49.Rd7 Red2 50.Rxd2 Rxd2 51.Kf1 Bd4 52.Nd3 g5 53.Nc5 gxh4 54.gxh4 Bxc5 55.bxc5 Rc2 56.Rf6+ Kg7 57.Rc6 Kf7 58.Ke1 Ke7 59.Kd1 Rc4 60.Kd2 Rxh4 61.Kc3 Ra4 62.Rxa6 h4 63.Kb3 Ra1 64.Kb4 Kd7 65.Rh6 Rb1+ 66.Kc4 Rc1+ 67.Kb5 Rb1+ 68.Ka6 Ra1 69.Kb7 Rb1+ 70.Rb6 Rc1 71.c6+ Kd6 72.Rb2 h3 73.a6 h2 74.Rd2+ Kc5 75.Rxh2 Rb1+ 76.Kc7

00:00 Hello Everyone!
00:29 Game Starts!
01:46 Completely New Game!
12:15 Pause the video!!!
14:00 It Was In This Position
14:50 Contributions

The 2022 FTX Crypto Cup sees Magnus Carlsen, Alireza Firouzja, Levon Aronian, Anish Giri, Jan-Krzysztof Duda, Liem Le, Hans Niemann and Praggnanandhaa gather in the Eden Roc Miami Beach Hotel in Miami, Florida for the 2nd Major on the $1.6 million Meltwater Champions Chess Tour. $210,000 and a $100,000 Bitcoin bonus is at stake in the 7-round all-play-all tournament. Each match consists of 4 rapid games on the chess24 Playzone, with the winner earning $7,500 (3 points). If the match is tied there's a blitz tiebreak, with 2 blitz games followed, if needed, by a single Armageddon game. The winner earns $5,000 (2 points) and the loser $2,500 (1).

For each rapid game the players have 15 minutes for all their moves, with a 10-second increment after each move. For blitz games it's 5 minutes and a 3-second increment, while for the Armageddon game White has 5 minutes to Black's 4, but a draw counts as a win for Black. No draw offers are allowed before move 40. Official website: chess24.com/tour
